column4: [Phaedrus] , that doesn't solve his current problem... don't say pointless comments...
it wouldnt be worth the hazzle to try to plug in a ISA card, you know
I already found the drivers for his card and posted it to him in PM, but that's going to require recompiling the kernel

I am sure it is possible to make it work... and i would guide him through it, if it was his computer... when its a friend's computer, it can get hard to sit there and let the compilation run for a few hours
